Posts.Content: msdicken wrote: I just came from a second opinion today - and I feel like I am back to square one waiting for my first biopsy report.  Initial dx from Dr. #1 was DCIS.  Have lumpectomy scheduled for 1/21/09.  After meeting today Dr. #2 thinks may not be DCIS as the onset from my normal mamm. in 7/08 to me finding a large (4cm) lump 12/08 questionable.  Both in agreement for lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy next to get a bigger picture, but then methods used in lumpectomy differ.  Do I now get a third opinion?  Switch Drs?  I like both but in different ways.  Right now I am confused - any opinions on 2nd opinions? Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2009 05:05AM msdicken wrote: After my 1st biopsy that came with mild atypia, I stilled move forward with an already scheduled MRI because of my family history of BC - my mother is a 35 year survivor.  The finding by MRI showed asymmetric segmental enhancement involving entire upper inner quadrant.  Still recommend excisional biopsy despite atypia result.  Also listed BI-RADS as code 5.  Hence then the 2nd biopsy that then showed DCIS. After meeting Doc #2 and going over films and path reports she wonders if there is an error in the sample or that that the pathologist sampled as if looking for DCIS only.  She has not seen my slides yet, but the intent is to have this hospital's path lab redo and use additional staining methods.  Apparently some types of invasive cancers can look like in situ.  Both my Doc are breast surgeons (and dept directors) and I am comfortable with both - One is very scientific in her approach and has much more of a Dr./Patient relationship (but not in a stand off way) while the other is more peer to peer.

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2009 09:32AM msdicken wrote: Thank you all for input.  Having the lumpectomey and SNB are not the issue, My concerns grew from the methods used in lumpectomy  Doc #2 apparently removes the lump and margins and then goes back for additional segmented margins.  She also felt that I should have margins removed from behind my nipple because of the location and bloody discharge from my nipple.  I  spoken to my liaison from Dr #1 this morning and have asked for more detail from the surgeon about her methods.  The choice I am currently obsessing on is do I switch Drs?  Sadly I am the only one who can make that one.
